page.title: 11ECONOMY
page.content: {THE VILLAGE POST OFFICE - WHITEGATE. The Post Office building is quite a modern one,replacing a wattle and daub building which is, at present, being converted into a dwelling.The retail outlet is incorporated with the Post Office counter and a small snack-bar. The present Postmistress has held the position for nine months. She points out that the Post Office section attracts more business than the shop. All the usual postal services are on offer except car road taxes which must be purchased at a Crown Office. The nearest is in Winsford. About 100 people per day use the Post Office.The busiest day is Thursday, pension day. Tuesday, family allowance day,is not as busy. Few children live in the village.The shop provides a village meeting place.
